page.title: 04INTRODUCTION TO PEATLING
page.content:
Peatling Magna, or Great Peatling is two and a half miles south-east of Countesthorpe, and nine miles south of Leicester centre.
The village is situated in a small valley, fed with water from a small stream which flows through the village but is not seen from the street. It is a plain, old-fashioned village, but quite attractive in its way.
The main activity is farming. There are 8 farms in the parish of Peatling Magna, all are quite old. They provide the village with produce, work and income.
